Reviews.Title: “Make No Mistake...This is Not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: Group_Hotel_Pro
Reviews.Content: Calling this the Celebration World Resort is a misnomer because there is nothing resort-ish about it. In fact, in my opinion (and I have been a travel professional for 15 years), this does not even qualify as a hotel. There is no housekeeping service, no food & beverage service, no internet connection available (NONE, not even an option to pay for internet), and no concierge services (other than the sponsored ticket sales booth...that is a vendor, not a concierge). If you are looking for a cheap place to stay and won't miss not having any of the typical services provided at a hotel, then this is okay. But they should not be calling this property a resort. That is not true. The location is off a semi-residential road. It takes about 6-7 minutes to get to I-4 and 15 minutes to get up to central Disney property. Coming back can take longer because of the left turn onto Atlantis. That is a heavily congested intersection. The furniture is all junk in this place. It is nice having the space of an apartment and the full kitchen, but the couch is ancient, the beds are the cheapest quality spring mattresses (the majority of the hotel industry now competes on quality of their beds...these kinds have not gotten that message). And the TV reception is really bad. I suspect it is from trying to push a modern digital cable provider through really old worn out TV's.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose for the price we paid, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: BIGBERT305
Reviews.Content: here are the negatives... 1. Walls are paper thin. 2. Any type of room service or clean towels/sheets cost extra $. 3. Time share and sales pitch upon checking in. 4. Guard gate is only used at night but half the time the security guard isn't there. 5. Room furniture is VERY OLD and outdated ! (bedroom has a VCR in it). 6. Washer was broken 7. Garbage container is by stair well instead of away from building. Came back one night and was almost attacked by huge Raccoon eating out of trash on my way to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, dirty and sneaky”
Reviews.Author: jsmil7460
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware. I was nervous about reserving but did anyway. Upon checking in my card was charged 200 instead of 50 for the security. The toilet didn't worked and maintenance came to fix it. The blanket was dirty with stains and the sofa was also dirty and looked like it would fal apart. These few things ruined it for me. I went and brought me a blanket from walmart to lay across the bed and covered up with my jacket. Long story short, I checked out a day early and was out 80 for the second night. It was that bad that I did not want to stay another night.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: starrwit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Celebration World Resort for four nights in Room L31. I was in town for business training and desired a room with a kitchenette so that I could cook meals and save money. I was pleased with the amenities but not "wow"-ed. Here are (what I consider) some of the PROS: 1) Location was good for me. Off of the busy stretch but within a few miles of grocery stores, restaurants, Target, and tourist shops. 2) Kitchenette: all appliances worked well. There was a nice convection oven/microwave with removable rack, a two-burner stove, the freezer had an ice maker, small dishwasher worked well, and my favorite was the stacked laundry machines. Everything was in good shape. 3) Giant soaking tub. It was not jetted but was very deep and accommodated my larger frame just fine. 4) I had no problem with cell phone service. 5) Saw guests with pets so resort must be pet-friendly 6) Main living area and bathroom was tile. 7) Staff was very helpful and polite. 8) Complimentary internet is available in the lobby; two computers are available for guests but have a time limit of 20 minutes and will automatically log off. 9) Not one bug found in the room! Room was cleaned well too (except carpet...see "Cons"). 10) Nice balcony accessible from the living room and the bedroom. The Cons: 1) Paper thin walls. One night I had some rowdy young neighbors who admired foul language and loud music. When someone is talking down the hall it sounds like they are right in front of your door. Luckily they quieted down by 11 PM (the "quiet time" at the resort) and stayed just one night. You can hear when others flush the toilets- these are jet powered toilets, mind you. 2) Not much to do at the resort itself. There was a pool and jacuzzi that looked nice, but I was surprised there was not a fitness center or recreation room. Perhaps I just wasn't informed about them but I couldn't find one on the resort map. 3) My room had an odd inventory. I had one coffee mug, two juice glasses and two iced-tea glasses, etc. I found an inventory sheet which threatened that if I didn't turn it in within 24 hours of checking in, I'd be charged for missing items upon check out. So I did the sheet and walked it to the front desk where the lady said, "Wow, we don't even do these anymore. I can't believe this was still in your room!" But she did ask if I needed any items from the list- I got a toaster for the room. 4) No kitchen garbage can. I remedied this by tying the kitchen bag to the bathroom door. Not a big deal for me but some would be inconvenienced by this, I'm sure. 5) Outdated decor, TVs and furniture. This didn't bother me too much because they were all functional, just ugly. BUT the couch was the most uncomfortable thing I've ever sat on. Adding pillows from the closet helped a little bit. 6) Mattress and box spring did not match- looked like the $100 deal from the local "last chance" mattress store. Not very comfortable. It did have a mattress pad. I was disappointed that the pillows did not have zippered pillow covers separating them from the top pillowcase. I thought that was a bit unhygienic. Luckily I had my own pillow with me. 7) Bedroom carpet was nasty. Commercial grade that had probably never been shampooed. Two stains at foot of the bed. The carpet actually dirtied my socks. Ew! They'd have been better off doing tile throughout. 8) Construction at front entry of resort. This didn't bother me but might bother others. My room was at the back of the resort so I didn't really hear anything. 9) Some highway noise can be heard early in the morning. 10) VHS player in the bedroom, DVD in the living room. This was inconvenient for me because I wanted to watch movies in bed but could not because I brought DVDs. I suppose I could have swapped machines. Overall the resort served its purpose for me. I had somewhere to stay within close reach of my training and I was able to save money by cooking and doing laundry in my room. I got this room for less than $60 per night on an internet site, which in my opinion is a very good deal for this type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Poor RCI Resort, never again!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth F
Reviews.Content: This place is so run down. Lamps don't work, couch lumpy (not pulled out even) Cabinet doors don't even close (doors put on overlapping in kitchen & bathroom) I would never of let that pass in my house. Cracks in tile floors. I haven't been out of room to see rest of property yet (just got in last night). Sure won't take tour of this kind of property. Very unhappy RCI member.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: kctapp
Reviews.Content: We did not have as bad an experience as many of the reviews, but overall it was nothing special. The carpet was worn out in several spots, the couch may have been the most uncomfortable piece of furniture I have ever sat on, and the TV was old in '95. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were nice and large. Liked having the washer and dryer in room, but they were pretty small. The pool area was great for young kids. Biggest complaint was the lack of WIFI in the rooms! Didn't feel like sitting in the lobby to do work online, so this was a big hassle. I was surprised that they gave you no information in the room, no channel guide or other directions. Location was convienient to all the attractions, but other than fast food not a lot of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nov. 18-25- 2011 A 7 Day Exchange of Cancún Time Share through RCI to Celebration World Resort, Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ivan J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old hotel. Before we got there, over the phone they told us that we would have to be present in the room, for them to give service, due to problems with theft. We never got towels changed, we had to wash them ourselves in the washer, and we were told that if we wanted the rooms to be cleaned or beds made, we had to pay $125 dollars per day. They had to come and fix, both sliding patio doors, which did not lock. They fixed them right away though. I would not recommend this resort. it looks like rci should take them of their list. This is the first time I exchange my time shares paying an additional $200 besides my maintenance fee. I was not happy with rci and celebration world resort In kissimmee, florida

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with any RCI resorts that we have stayed in over 22 years!”
Reviews.Author: Bdezhoney
Reviews.Content: Check in was pretty fast. Went to unit, it was hot upon entering. Layout of unit is ok... Nothing to write home about. TV's are very outdated. This is without a doubt the first resort ever that had no info in the unit, I.e., nothing telling you which channels are which, etc., no resort info notebook at all! But guess since there are apparently no activities going on here, they figured why bother?? The larger safe in master closet does not work. Thank goodness we haven't seen a roach yet... I'd be out of here in a heartbeat. Haven't seen pool area yet. There are units here though with only partial unit numbers on them, looks quite dirty on exterior in areas. Sitting here listening to so much noise from other units, there are 3 floors here, we are on the second. I really think that RCI needs to look into this place, gives RCI a bad name!

Reviews.Title: “Still Feeling Sick”
Reviews.Author: john g
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth time staying there, it was average in the past. This stay was terrible. ROACHES in the kitchen. Roach feces in the bottom cabinets. Worst of all was when I decided to take a shower this morning in the spare bathroom. On the window shelf where you place your shampoo was someone’s hair (to include pubic). Not a small amount, a prior guest must have done some hair work and no one cleaned up. To this minute I still cannot believe it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nimbus C
Reviews.Content: I should have taken the negative reviews seriously. I've been to many resorts accross the world and this, by far, is the absolute worse. Nothing to do, staff barely helpful if at all, the pool was disgustingly filthy.....and it was the ONLY real amenity on the property. Old furniture, smelly bed covers, broken appliances, pool towels slightly larger than a mini skirt.. and the staff behave like they are doing YOU a favour. I was extremely disappointed with the experience and will say only that this place is a disaster waiting just to happen.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for amenities and kids activities dont come here.”
Reviews.Author: DJBell0406
Reviews.Content: Decent, no cleaning or housekeeping but I can do that myself. W/D great pool for my daughter. Close to everything. As a Federal Agent I stayed in better and worse so this falls square in the middle. One benefit was I was not bothered by timeshare sales people and other leeches. If by myself I would have been fine.

Reviews.Title: “Close to disney, decent and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: robsnyder22
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I wanted to say that my stay was pleasant, no problems, no barking dogs and was nice. This was my first time staying on this property. I have stayed at several nicer resorts but after reading the reviews, I was just hoping this place was not worse than a $30 per night hotel that I have stayed in, in orlando. But after staying here, the rooms were nice and everything was clean. Yes, the resort could use a coat of paint and some landscaping, but the pool was nice and enjoyable. I stayed in one of the units in the back (building H), didn't have to count dishes, didn't have a complicated check out procedure, didn't have a wierd resort fee, and did have a good gate security. Overall, I felt the resort promoted a safe atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Tired.........”
Reviews.Author: sje15
Reviews.Content: Really close to Disney and directions are really easy. The pool area is large and very kid-friendly. But..........the resort itself is quite simply tired. The suites are large and with a few upgrades, this location would be well worth visiting. But the decor and furniture really need help! We did not intend to spend a lot of time there, and so really just wanted a place to sleep. A good thing, because, aside from the pool, there really wasn't any good reasn to want to stick around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for visiting Disney World. Very close also!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrandma10
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 2 granddaughters, ages 7 & 9 for 1 week at the Celebration World Resort. After I made the reservation, I wanted to change our arrival date by 1 day. At first they were reluctant, but after I emailed the manager, they slipped the arrival date. The check-in was fast and the clerks were courteous. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath which was very spacious and clean. We were on the 3rd floor, but had an elevator. The furniture was a little worn, but still in fair condition and the kitchen was short on some dishes. The pool was the best attraction of the resort. The girls wanted to leave Disney World early enough everyday so they could swim. The other positive about the resort was the location. It took only 10-15min to drive to Disney. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Run from this resort!!!!! Do not pass go, do not collect $100.00!!!”
Reviews.Author: Belmont3038
Reviews.Content: This resort is the worst I have ever stayed in during my 20 plus years of timesharing!!! I check out after the first night. It is very run down and needs upgrading. The furniture was very soiled and old. The so called big screen TV was dark and you could barely see the picture in the screen. The toilets sounded like a gun going off each time you flush. We were afraid to sleep in the beds. I felt it was atrocious to the highest degree!!! Some may like it, but my family hated it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Spezzina
Reviews.Content: Dirty, smelly, no amenities and poor service. They give you a checklist when you get there and when you show them how much is missing they thank you for helping them inventory! The tv is ancient and there was furniture MISSING from our room when they finally gave us one that did not stink of smoke. The sliding doors on the ground floor do not have safety bars...the kiddie play area was dingy and unsafe. The water from their cascade umbrella had to be 30 degrees if not colder. No towels, no amenities, dishes not microwave safe, resort in sad state of disrepair, with torn and dingy awnings. We were told they are between owners when in fact they should be between bulldozers. Worst resort we have ever visited!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a large group with children. Centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: TavellingMom
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at the resort after reading the mixed reviews. We went for a week during the height of Spring Break (the week leading up to Easter) and I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. There were five adults and three children (ages 3 yrs thru 11 yrs) in our party. The two room suite was plenty spacious enough for everyone and there was also a screened in balcony. The place was very clean and equipped with just about everything one might want: iron/ironing board, pots & pans, dishes, coffee machine, stove, dishwasher, fridge, washer and dryer. Was it a 5 star resort, no. However, if you are looking for a homey place that is good to relax while you park hop everyday then this is the place for you. The resort was minutes from all of the major attractions. Disney was the closest and Universal was the farthest with Sea World and Discovery Cove in between. The resort is located very close to many restaurants and shops where you can find anything that you may want or need. The staff was friendly and the pool area was well-maintained. The only negative thing that I have to say is that the water temperature was quite warm and therefore was not refreshing considering the Florida heat. Bottom line is that this place was ideal for our situation. If you want a place that is like home and very close to the parks, you are travelling with a large group, or with children, then this is the place for you. If you want onsite dining or a luxury experience then you should look elsewhere. We came to Florida for the sites; not a hotel and all of our expectations were met by Celebration World.

Reviews.Title: “semi-annual Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: ergirl08
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Celebration resort for a few years because we have a small dog. It is not gold crown but it is comfortable, and we can bring our pet. In fact we are going back in a few days. We normally end up with a small one bedroom with a partial kitchen. I am a cook so, i have not been to happy with just a partial kitchen but this time we have a two bedroom full kitchen. I do enjoy the pool area on our last trip minus the dog we stayed elsewhere and the pool area was not as nice as Celebration's pool.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: trumsey
Reviews.Content: It was laid back which was good. Poolside entertainment was ping pong, was expecting a little more than that. Poolside towel service would have been nice. The staff was very professional and nice, kudos. The pictures online do not represent the actual resort, no frills in the rooms as pictured. I just don't think they clean as well as they could. Hair in clothes drawer (vac it out), 2 keycard envelopes left by previous occupants, stuff like that.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD TIME, CLOSE TO ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: john006_1
Reviews.Content: Had two of us, two adult kids and 3 teenagers, 2 kids. The only complaint was about the lack of internet service. I have stayed here several times since I bought here before the buildings were built. I am concerned about the lack of progression in the plans we have been showed over the years. Seems to me not enough is being put back into maintenance and progression. I was treated well by all and had no problems. I would like to know how they keep the glass shower doors clean, I have never been able to keep mine that clear.

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD”
Reviews.Author: frugel-traveler
Reviews.Content: Only needed to stay two nights and had no trouble making reservations. Stayed in a Senior 1 bd, which would be a little cramped for a family. The kitchen is very small but was fine for me since I didn't cook. Had washer/dryer which was great. The only drawback; this has to be the most boring resort in Orlando. No one at the pool, no activities and no where close to go without a car. But it is a nice quiet place to stay. I have stayed here several times with my family and it has gone down hill the past few years. My wife would not be happy here so I stay by myself waiting for a update.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: miatraveling
Reviews.Content: I used my RCI points to stay at Celebration World Resort and was so disappointed I checked out two days early. I would not call this a resort. It has a pool, but it’s just a notch above a motel. If you plan to spend anytime in the “resort” keep in mind that the rooms do not appear to have been upgraded since the 1980s. The furniture is scratched and or stained, you could feel the coils in the mattress, the TVs are small and not HD, there is nothing within walking distance and the rooms have no Wifi, so you can't use your computer. Not everyone agrees with my perception. During my stay I met couples who have been coming here for years looking for warm weather. They were from Canada, Illinois, Ohio. If all you are looking for is warmer weather or a place to sleep in between Disney / Universal visits, then this might work for you. I found ONLY one positive fact with this "resort," it accepts pets. But despite the fact that I'm always looking for a place that accepts pets, this will not be one I will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: alaskapups01
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for us to stay. We were able to get to Disney in just a few minutes each morning, so the location was great. There were 6 of us travelliing - two 70 year old grandparents, two 30 year old parents, one 35 year old uncle, and a 2.5 year old toddler. We rented two adjoining one bedroom units that were clean and comfortable. Sure, the couches were a little worn, the TV picture was a little fuzzy (we played a movie and it was perfect, so I think it was their cable reception) and the place wasn't brand new, but they never claimed to be a 5 star luxury resort. It was a bummer that they only had wifi in the lobby and not in any of the buildings. The heated pool/hot tub was a lot of fun. It was an affordable and comfortable place to stay. For the price, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: beccasmk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and loved it. The kitchen was very well equipped and the rooms were very clean! LIttle one loved the whilpool tub. The screened in patio was a plus as well. Loved the walk in beach side of the pool! Parking lot was well lit and there were plenty of parking spaces right next to our room. We loved it and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “This resort needs major repairs/renovations!”
Reviews.Author: Disneydreaming
Reviews.Content: We moved to this resort after a week at Vacation Villages at Parkway. We were very disappointed by the run-down appearance and lack of cleanliness of the first building and room we were given. The building needed to be repainted and the plantings were dead or dying. The carpet in the unit was very stained and worn. I asked to be moved to another unit and was told that they were all similar because the resort was due for it's first update and renovation. I was given a unit in a building closer to the front of the resort and it was better. The floor was tile instead of stained carpet which made a big difference. The staff was very helpful throughout our stay and I would say that they are the resorts biggest asset at this point. My kids also enjoyed the pool and kids' craft/activity center.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Gita27
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this resort as it was one of only a handful in the country thru RCI that allows pets. We were prepared for less than perfect surroundings due to this fact and some of the reviews here on Tripadvisor, but were extremely pleased with our surroundings. And the pooch loved the grounds and lakeside track, not to mention all the other pups he could visit with. If we'd had the time and the supplies we would have loved to cook out on the lakeside grills. We would have no qualms recommending the resort to others. There was a stain here or there, but it was certainly clean and comfortable. The bed was one of the best I've slept on in ages. I have dust mite and mold allergies and they did not act up while staying here--however, I took my own pillow coverings just in case. The kitchen was even equipped with a toaster, blender, teapot, electric can opener, etc. not just the necessities. We did have a problem with the washer not draining, but when we called the desk, maintenance visited and replaced the part within 10 minutes. I'm sure the appliances have a bit more than the usual wear and tear. Another unit experienced a mild kitchen smoke incident and maintenance was there to check on them and insure everyone was safe within 2 minutes flat. The pool is great--love that it is open late. However, it is getting a bit cool and the heaters don't keep it as warm as I would like it. Though the resort is fairly close to Disney, our main destination was Universal and we did not have any issues with slow-moving traffic along I-4 any day we headed north. In fact, we could be parked and in the park in less than 30 minutes. We also really enjoyed Wildside BBQ on Irlo Bronson a couple of miles away. Great calamari, bbq chicken quesadillas and soups! Hope to be able to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “fell ill due to mildew or mold or dust”
Reviews.Author: murfsgirl
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 3 companions from work, all traveling separately and staying in different rooms, and we all were sick by the end of the trip. The rooms are not obviously dirty besides the overwhelming mildew smell and stained carpets, but somehow all of us had some sort of respiratory ailment by the end of the trip. My room smelled so bad that I have to wash every item I brought with me now that I'm home. The bed is terrible, my shoulders were falling asleep from it. Even though the bedrooms are in the back of the unit, you can hear all your neighbors when they open or close their impossible to work doors or walk around. You can also hear your neighbors shower and flush their toilets. Plus, the resort had lawn people working at 8 AM on a Saturday. Who does that? However, the security staff is wonderful. They helped me when I couldn't get in because the doors are insane, and I felt safe. I would never stay here again; it's not worth the lack of sleep and getting ill.

Reviews.Title: “SECURITY GUYS ,WANT TO BE HERO'S”
Reviews.Author: bethzaida3
Reviews.Content: I woulden't ever come back here, the security people think they are soo important. There just a bunch of controll freak loooossssseeeerrrrrssss.I f you have any liberatarian in you, and you enjoy freedom, than dont stay here. Democrats will love the controlling and regulating from these wanna be cops.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe I bought into this place...”
Reviews.Author: DerrikAmmons
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my vacation from Orlando. Keep in mind as you read this that I am an owner of this resort but this was my first time actually staying here since I bought it over 8 years ago. I have always exchanged it at RCI and knew that I’d come back once my kids were old enough to enjoy the theme parks. I think back then it was a Gold Crown designation. If you plan on owning at this resort, please beware. When I first bought it, I saw the potential. There were only a few buildings up and when I saw the model in the sales room, I figured it would be worth it when they finish the entire construction. They even showed me a nice model room during the presentation and told me how much they were going to grow and I have yet to see it grow as large as that model in the sales room. They recently showed me another room during the presentation and it is nothing near the room they actually gave me. I am very disappointed in this place. I really feel like a sucker buying this place. We own two other time shares, one in Maui and one in Cancun, and we have stayed at so many resorts in the past 10 years, vacationing once or twice a year and this one is the worse we’ve ever been. First the good news… 1. The staff is friendly and courteous. 2. The pool was refreshing and fun for the kids. 3. The Air Conditioner is outstanding (when it works). 4. The security upon entering the grounds is pretty good. However, upon opening the front door to unit B33, it was great at first site, but soon after looking around… 1. Master Bathroom light bulb was out. • Called Front Desk and Maintenance replaced it. 2. Carpets were really filthy with stains and holes. 3. Remote Control to the living room television was missing. • Called Front Desk and Maintenance gave us a brand new one, but it didn’t work, so we had to replace that one, too. 4. There were no bath towels • Called Front Desk and a bag of towels were brought up. 5. Kitchen faucet cap was broken and water was not easy to turn on. 6. Furniture was really dingy, including the Sofa, Kitchen table chairs. Some furniture had stains on them. 7. Televisions seemed more than a decade old. • Sales showed us LCD screens in the model rooms. After staying the first night, here are some more observations… 1. Master Shower door would not close easily. 2. Master Bathroom lock did not work. 3. Guest Bathroom tub was stained. 4. One sheet had a blood stain on it 5. One of the towels was stained and had holes. 6. Another towel had ripped while drying my back. 7. There was dent in the refrigerator door. 8. Sofa bed had dead bugs on the mattress. 9. One of the blankets had human hair on it. 10. There were no nonstick pans so prepare to burn everything you cook or bring a lot of cooking oil. 11. The clothes dryer does not dry at all unless you have just one piece of clothing in it. 12. There is no wireless internet in the room; or wired for that matter. • Only in the lobby and pool area provides wireless service. 13. Volume for the Living room TV went out. • Called Front Desk and Maintenance came up and fixed it but blamed the lighting storm. Hmmm….. 14. Air Conditioner went out. • Called Front Desk and told me to reset the breaker for the AC. (It worked.) • The problem is that it went out sometime during the day and when we came back from a hot day at Disney it was like an oven. 15. Not all outlets seemed to work. 16. One of the two key cards stopped working. • Front desk reset it and told me to keep it away from my credit cards and cell phones. Hmmm… 17. We found a large red ant crawling along the bed near my 3 year old son. 18. The TV stands in the bedroom has doors that don’t retract inside the unit and thus stick out so that you can bump into them every time you walk by. • Not really safe if you have a 5 year old and 3 year old playing around the bed. 19. I found a letter on the floor outside my neighbor’s door. • It mentioned a welcome package. I didn’t get anything but a crappy room. • The second letter for my neighbor mentioned $100 exchange promotion and I got $50. • Obviously my neighbors were not owners and they wanted to suck them into buying into this resort. 20. I got a call for what I thought was going to be an owner’s meeting but turned out to be another sale’s presentation. • I even had this list of items to discuss with the staff and other owners but they tried selling me another program which was “especially available only for us owners”. • They were great but I just wasn’t in the mood to buy something where I was already disappointed with the resort. Also their reservation site that they were raving about didn’t work. • I’ve been to many of these sales presentations and this was definitely below par. All resort sales presentations I have attended had better food selection and more variety of drinks. And their website actually worked. Maybe all the people who had recently given this resort good reviews must have stayed in the model units because the unit I checked into was horrible. Perhaps they were not owners and the resort wanted to sell them ownership and purposely had given them the better unit. Whatever the case, if the other rooms were as bad as mine, this place is in dire need of help. Unless, of course they find a few suckers like me.

Reviews.Title: “Worst resort I've seen”
Reviews.Author: flgrays
Reviews.Content: We arrived on July 17, 2010 as an RCI trade in. We were a little leary when we checked in because the buildings and awnings were in need of cleaning. We checked in and were sent to building J. The courtyard had dirt with no grass or flowers, just dirt. We went upstairs to the unit to find a corroded and rusty stove, dingy looking bedspreads. A layer of dust sat atop the living room drapes. The chairs had dust on the backs.The tv stand had a thick layer of dust on it. The bathroom jets looked corroded. On our way out we saw a spider web with a bug in it in the corner above the door. We asked for a different room that might be cleaner. Security came witha key and took us to another unit that had a fake granite countertop that someone had spilled sugar on. The bedspreads still looked dingy. The living room had a 7 foot tear in front of the sofa. The jets in the bathroom still looked corroded. We checked out, and checked in to Star Island instead. Don't waste your timeunless you get their model room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodations”
Reviews.Author: deskk
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this place after reading other reviews here but we had a great time. The condo was spotlessly clean. The staff was polite and although we did get a sales call - they did not call again when we told them we weren't interested. The condo had everything we needed and we ate breakfast here daily. We didn't hang here tons since Disney was the main reason for the visit.The pool was clean and my kids loved it. My complaints were mostly minor. NO Internet in the condo....this was a big pain. Not enough towl racks or hanging hooks for stuff in the bathrooms. We would come back here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Resort EVER !”
Reviews.Author: kmr64
Reviews.Content: Check in went very smooth, had to give a credit card and they put a $50. hold on it so I asked what is the $50. for and they answered for "any accidental reasons" I get all checked in, then was sent across the room to get my parking pass, which made no sence at first. then I was asked which felt like a 100 questions about who was in my group and if there would be a "MR" joining me.. because we were there for our daughters dance competition, I told the lady we had no time for anything other then the competition.she finally gave me my car pass and off I went to find our Unit .. My daughter and I felt like we where in the slums of some city, I called my husband and told him I did not want to stay there and that I was going back to the Hotel in Disney. or I was going to call RCI to see if we could move to another resort, he told me just wait until he arrived. The courtyard outside our unit was a horrible mess there was trash over flowing in the barrel. dead palm tree I did not see one flower, inside the unit it was very clean but looks like the furniture was from the eightys. Now for the list of problems, the closet door in the guest bedroom one door did not open, the towel rack in the master bath fell off the wall, the shower door did not open or close right, the toilet was the loudest thing ever, as a matter of fact everytime a toilet was fluhed by another unit we could hear it, the walls seem to be thin, I could hear someone in the next unit snoring.. the air conitioner was very loud and did not cool the place to well, the ceiling fan in the master bedroom was so loud that we could not use it. and off balance looked like it was going to fall from the ceiling. the carpet had bubbles in it. the dryer took 3 hours to dry towels. and forget about the bed and pillows... this resort is in desperate need of renovation. if you belong to RCI DO NOT trade into this resort...

Reviews.Title: “Great condo - pleasantly surprised after some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: PJStephens
Reviews.Content: We booked this condo back in April for our family vacation to Disney and Universal. The reviews were somewhat mixed and I had some misgivings about it. We were very pleased with this resort. It looks like perhaps they have been remodeling and updating recently. The unit was clean and looked to be freshly painted. The grounds, clubhouse, and pool were spotless. All the staff were friendly and helpful. It was just a short distance from the main highway, off the beaten path, but still very close to Disney. We liked that it seemed like you were in the "country" and not among all the hotels and restaurants. Very pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good experience”
Reviews.Author: novachick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer and were impressed with the condition of our condo and convenience to Disney World and restaurants. The condo had a very nice master bedroom and bath, and it was great having a kitchen and porch. The only complaint I have was that we had terrible cell service (not necessarily the resort's fault) and no wireless internet (although there is a computer station in the front desk building).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sage1949
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Oct 09. We had 2 rooms. One for us and our small dogs and One for my daughter and her husband. We returned Jun 10, without the dogs, as we really enjoyed our stay in Oct. After reading some of the terrible things on here...I have no idea where those folks stayed! I have now been in 3 different buildings and rooms. Every room/Building I stayed was fine! Staff is so friendly. Even the gardeners, maintenance, housekeeping on the grounds greet you pleasantly and ask if you have need/everything ok. The room our Daughter had was one of the best. I'm sure it is one they use for the timeshare presentation. Even though our room was not as luxurious, (we had the dogs) still there was nothing wrong with it. Nice to have a pool open to midnight! Alot of times, when i go to a hotel, i can never use the pool as we are busy in day and after dinner..pool is closed. Oh and my husband has a bad back(not resort's fault)His back has never suffered here. Believe me, his back has spoiled some of our nicest trips. We are planning on returning in Nov/Dec.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: pantherfansc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter to Florida as a college-graduation present. We are RCI owners and traded in points to go to Orlando. Here's how everything went: -Check-in: Staff was very pleasant. I was directed to another counter to get my parking pass, which was really just a ploy to have to listen to a timeshare sales pitch. I advised the woman that we were already owners, but she insisted on trying to set us up for a "60 minute session," and the prize would be $60 off of tickets to some attraction. The only way I could get out of making an appointment was to tell her that I'd have to talk to my husband, who would not be in until the following day, which was Saturday. We were dozing on Sunday morning when the phone rang at about 8:15 AM. It was the same lady asking me if I'd had a chance to talk to my husband yet. I finally convinced her that we did not want to come to any of her "sessions," but it really bothered me that we were given the hard sell when we only wanted to relax. And she knew we were already owners; did she think we wanted to buy a SECOND timeshare??? -Unit: Our unit was clean enough, but the walls were paper-thin. We could hear all of our neighbors' conversations. The towels were of the lowest quality possible; one of them even had a big hole in it. The washer and dryer were fine but very small-capacity, so only about three towels would fit per load. The biggest problem was that we could not regulate the temperature. It was always too hot or too cold, and it seemed like the thermostat was broken because when it was freezing it would be set on 80. -Grounds/pool: The landscaping crew was always out and about, and the grass always looked nice. However, the units themselves were rundown. Several were in need of a power-washing. Our unit had weird green paint streaks around the porch, as if someone started a painting project that they never finished. The resort boasted that it provided two grills for guests to use, but when we inspected these grills we found so much gunk that needed to be scraped off that we decided it wasn't worth it. The pool area seemed nice at first: lots of chairs, unlimited use of [cheap] towels, etc. However, there was a thin layer of bugs floating on the top of the pool every morning when it had stormed the night before. They had streamed in some pleasant 80s music, but the volume was set so loud that you couldn't even have a conversation. The first time I used the restroom, I pulled on the end of the toilet paper roll and the whole dispenser came crashing down on my shoulder. Upon closer inspection, I found that someone had repaired the dispenser with clear packing tape, and that it had been undone and re-taped many times. When I was walking out of the restroom, I almost stepped in a brown smudge that was appeared to be human waste. I went into the clubhouse lobby, grabbed the first person I could find, and walked him out to the restroom. He was very nice and apologetic, and told me he'd take care of it. Unfortunately, that meant that the entire restroom was shut down for the rest of the day. The next day, I saw that the brown smudge was gone, but that the toilet paper dispenser was still held together with the same piece of packing tape. (I saw the same employee later that day, and he asked me if I was feeling better, and he seemed genuinely polite. However, when I first took him to the restroom to show him the "issues," he had asked me what my room number was. I fully expected a follow-up call from management or maybe even the offer of some sort of upgrade, but I got nothing. The only person who acknowledged my injury was that same maintenance worker.) -Convenience: This resort is very convenient to to the theme parks and attractions. -Recommendation: I cannot recommend this resort to anyone. Our "real" timeshare is in Cashiers, NC, and it feels like a resort. This place felt like a cheap motel in many ways, and I would never want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Cholzwarth
Reviews.Content: We went to Celebration World Resort as an RCI exchange in April 2010. The carpets were stained and dirty. The sofa was stained and looked dirty. The chairs in the dining were stained. We looked at four units and took the best of the four. The first unit stunk so bad we could not bear it. In the final unit, we still had to cover the sofa and chairs with towels and sheets to use them. The mattress covers were stained. We got our own sheets and pillow cases for the bed. None of the units we looked at had no weather stripping in the doors, this means that bugs come and go at will. The “big screen” TV was a projection TV with a rip in the screen. Parts of the dish washer were broken and the dish washer had rust inside it. We washed our dishes by hand while we stayed there. The blinds were in similar disrepair. The first coffee maker did not work; this was replaced with a working one the same day. One of the units we looked at while searching for the least gross unit did not have working lights at all. The landscaping within the courtyards of the units was mostly dead and looked terrible. There are ant colonies everywhere. I received three stinging bites when I went for a walk. The concrete outside of the units is stained and obviously neglected. We complained and were invited to meet with an “RCI representative” who turned out to be a salesman. During the sales pitch, we found out that not many owners here come back to their resort. They do have units that are better maintained. These are used for owners. The focus of their maintenance and upgrade policy is to keep the yearly fees down. This means that there are essentially two classes of units here, ones for the owners and ones for everyone else. We were taken to one of the refurbished “owner” units during the tour. It has LCD TVs and was clean. Of course this does not indicate what the actual owner units really look like. In short, this is a property that is not kept up and you would be advised to consider sleeping in your car before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: zenaWebster
Reviews.Content: what do you cosider 5 star, is it sand alround the building, burnt grass, stained carpet,so bad kids could sit on floors,big brown stains in tub, so bad did not want to take shower in it. ask for more toliet and refused to give another roll. when the roll was only half full. went to pool and pipe bursts. how enjoyable was our vacation. noy very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “No Internet connection this is 2010”
Reviews.Author: jellyspotter
Reviews.Content: For all of you who wrote great and gave this place a good rating you must not travel that often and you must not know what a nice resort looks like. We were traveling with 2 cars of people staying at 2 different places. We happen to get the one star resort they got the 5. We arrive and have to drag all our luggage to two different units before we actually got into the correct 2 bedroom. Hour wasted after being in the car 18 to drive down here. Then my husband finds out there is no wifi connection. What place now adays doesn't allow you to use your computer in your room. Overall this place is a joke and shouldn't be allowed to call themselves a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Buyers beware this time sare is a joke”
Reviews.Author: vanclem
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 2 bed room villa 10 years ago from Celebration World Resort and have had noting but poblems with these people. They promised more units for more room when you book your week stay more activities at the resort but have done noting but raise my maintenance fees. After 10 years all we have is a pool and try to book a room they never have one available.I have only stayed in my unit four times in 10 years because they never have any thing available for at least six months and when you call to bank it with RCI you better hold there hand like a two year old child are it will not happen. The last time i did stay they wanted to see me for a sales pitch they gave me a $100.00 to come but here is the pitch if you give them $25,000.00 yes $25,000.00 more you can have two weeks at this hell hole and all there broken promises . I told them i would sell mine villa back to them for $7,000.00 i paid $12,900.00 they told me they don't buy units back. As a owner i have been run in circles by these poeple and very disappointed in this want to be resort.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay, take your own toilet paper.”
Reviews.Author: triphappyNewYork
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed were the many stains everywhere. Since it's a pet friendly place, I didn't want to even think about what had made all of the brown stains on the chair cushions. I do not have a pet, but was there because I had to change my reservation at the last minute and could only get into this place. On our first night, we discovered that we had no hot water. The guy they sent had to come up twice to fix it. The buttons on the phone in the living were ripped out, so we could only use the phone in the bedroom. On another night, we rented a movie at one of those dollar machines to watch in the DVD. It wouldn't play so we assumed that it was just because the dvd had a few scratches. So we rented the same dvd from the resort for $7. It still didn't work. The dvd player was broken so we had to call so they could replace it. One of the things that really shocked me was that on our second day we were running low on toilet paper. When I called housekeeping, they informed me that you only get a starter kit and that you have to buy your own after you run out. I've been to dozens of time-share resorts and I have never had to BUY my own toilet paper. Another crazy thing is that they wouldn't exchange our towels or do any housekeeping. You have to pay $35 for them to change the towels, make the bed up without changing the linens and load up the diswasher! All other time-share places replace your towels anytime you call and do the cleaning at least once or twice a week for free! They just don't take care of the little things that make a vacation stay comfortable. They didn't even have a gym! The worst thing was that the pool heater was broken. I had specifiically wanted a heated pool. Since it was only 67 to 75 degrees the whole week, the pool was freezing. They said it would soon be fixed. The hot tub worked, but everyone was trying to squeeze into it. The next day they said it was fixed. We threw on our suits and ran out there, only to discover that it was still freezing cold. They lied to us about it being fixed for 4 days. On the fourth day, they drained the hot tub and put caution tape all around it. An older couple told us that they had been there the year before at the same time and that the heater had been broken then too! That day I had enough and complained until I was moved to another place. There were just too many things wrong with this place. It's like they don't even care. The best thing about the place was that there were no rodents or vermin running around.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, dog friendly, not pushy, few corks, but OK”
Reviews.Author: vaderbarb
Reviews.Content: Have I stayed in better timeshares????...yes...wud i stay again? not as my first choice but if it was open sure. Check in was smooth. Its off rt 192 on a quiet road. Small resort.. Sales are not pushy at check in. WE unplugged the phones as i read that on another review so they did not bother you.Although on the last nite I was cleanin out the car and had our door open..maybe 40 feet from the car and a sercurity gaurd met me ready to close the door..nice to know they are there and was watchin, they tried to call and check if we leftthe door open ..but we had them unpluged.... When we got to our room the few cons were the adjorning room door was missin a hinge so it was hard to open. Washer was small, screen door knob broken on screen room, couch hard needs new cushions, one safe was gone and the next was so broken you couldnt open or close it w/o cuttin your hand.. All small stuff for the benifit of a peaceful vac week. Pros..full kitchen, 1/2 kitchen in next room, 2 washer and dryers with room set up, big jet tub, open shower, Lots of parkin,first come parkin, clean pool,dogs, friendly staff. I've seen better grounds and bigger resorts but this one is dog friendly ( i have dogs but did not vac with them here) small and realitively clean. Peacefully off the highway. not crowed, more adults then kids, but a few kids were there. Any questions you can contact me. I have prolly forgot some thing.

Reviews.Title: “ONE WORD -- SCAM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: relax-a-fun
Reviews.Content: We found this place while looking online for a resort. We stumbled across this resort that offered a week stay for around $400 without any knowledge or intentions of sitting through a briefing to become a "member". First of all, during the briefing the sales associate introduced us to all these great opportunities and extras if we choose to purchase timeshare with them. After all the bells and whistles, my husband and I chose to make the purchase in which the final contract was made on the day of our checkout. I tried contacting the sales associate about a month after leaving because it was explained to me that I can refer others to the resort and receive rewards. I left about 20 voicemail and email messages within a 30-day period and NO phone calls or emails returned...not even an acknowledgement. So i contacted the person of whom I originally spoke with that made my reservation, (before I arrived) Helena. She then told me to contact the Manager in which it took about 2 weeks to get a response from him. He sent me an email stating that he would take care of the issue and if I had anymore concerns to let him know. Bottomline.....THAT NEVER HAPPENED EITHER! When I call the resort after becoming a member for reservations, they always ask if i am a member. After being asked that "EVERYTIME" I called, i began to think members have priority. I was denied reservation everytime I called. So then, I had a friend call the day after and she was asked if she was a member, she said no, and they told her there was availability for her required dates of stay. This is what happens. Once a member, you have absolutely NO CHANCE of returning because they've already locked you in and getting your money. They want NEWBIES to come stay so that they can CON them into buying. It's been 4 years now since I've been trying with no success. However, they harass me for the annual maintenance fee for a resort i visited only once. At first I didn't mind paying the fee but got a bit discouraged after the continuous unavailability [for some folks which seem to be members]. Furthermore, not to mention the extra 50,000 points they gave me as a signing bonus and later took back because they said I should not have received them in the first year (which also says this in the contract). Their explanation, it was a mistake in the contract. My suggestion: It's a beautiful family friendly resort. If you want to continue vacation there, DO NOT LOCK IN A PURCHASE WITH THEM! THESE PEOPLE ARE NOT LEGIT AND SHOULD BE REPORTED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Been in better places...”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELER01GEORGIA
Reviews.Content: When first arrived, we did get to check in a couple hours earlier than normal check in which was nice. Televisions were outdated (Not flat screened). The sound on the large wide screen (boxed) teleivsion did not work. Would only pick up sound if it was a spanish speaking channel. (I guess I need to learn spanish as a second language before I come here again). Who uses VHS tapes anymore. Only one DVD player, rest of the rooms had VHS cassette players. Where not that many pots and pans available in the rooms to use. Had to make do with what was available or buy them. Rooms were clean and AC worked very good. However, the beds were hard as a rock. My back ached everyday from sleeping on the beds. Felt as if I was sleeping on the box spring the entire time. The place would have been much more enjoyable if there was a resturant or cafe available on site in addition to a fitness room. Location to the amusement park and other eating establishment was very good. I was impressed with the security at the gate. Of course if anyone could probably get in the resort if they had a sheet of paper on their dash board that had a lighthouse on it. Guards barely looked at the passes as we entered the resort. Parking spaces are not adequately close to the condos. It is very hard pulling in and out of the spaces because of the layout of them. I would probably stay again, but would bring additional pots and pans to cook with and a pillow top matress pad for the beds.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SuzanNorway
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was very dubious about this resort. We were traveling a long way (from Norway) and I had a bad holiday last year through RCI. Please don't let the reviews put you off...I was extremely pleased with this resort. Initially we were put in a ground floor room at the back of the resort and I was disappointed with it but after speaking to the receptionist, I was able to change rooms. The furniture is a bit dated but other than that it was perfect. The only downside was there is no shop/bar or cafe on site. But there is plenty of supermarkets, shops and restaurants on Highway 192 which takes less than 2 mins to drive to. The resort itself is quiet, clean and peaceful. There were quite a few families which had their dogs with them but there was certainly no dogs that continuously barked. I thought it was a great place especially if you did have a pet as there are some nice grounds to walk in. The pool area is clean and peaceful and I was lucky not to be hassled once by any timeshare reps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool area”
Reviews.Author: step4
Reviews.Content: 2 bedroom condo, nice layout, rugs could use an update, but overall very clean, great pool for kids of all ages. Complementary drinks in club house. Pool open until 12:00 p.m. each day. Kids 10, 12, 15, 16 loved this resort. I would recommend it. About 5 Mins drive from any Disney park, convenient location. Very quiet surronded by trees, it's like you are not even in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this resort and will return.”
Reviews.Author: Disneylvr1
Reviews.Content: We have been members of Blue Green Resorts since 1996 and occasionally have used the space bank service of RCI, which is how we came to Celebration World Resort. We live in Florida and visit Orlando regularly. We were delighted to learn that we could travel with our two dogs, both under 40 lbs., and did not mind the charge of $50 per pet for the week. We were wary of what the pet friendly buildings would be like, especially after reading the reviews. We found the staff to be professional and helpful. We received a call from the front desk a few hours after checking in, verifying that we were happy with the accomodations. The unit we occupied was not as lavish as some we have occupied, but it was adequate and comfortable. We did not hear our neighbors, even though the building was fully occupied. Guests were careful to pick up after their pets, and everyone we spoke with were delighted to be able to travel with their pets. I would have no hesitation recommending Celebration World to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good :(”
Reviews.Author: kboo127
Reviews.Content: (We were traveling with 2 children and a dog) We were excited, the place looked awesome! A Gated community, gorgeous pool, nice pond with fountain, a play area, and daily family activites. ...We got there checked in and went to our condo in the Pet Section. You could hear the dogs barking as if they were right beside you and we weren't even out of our car. Got in the room and it was HOT and smelled Musty. The AC was on the coldest setting...Hubby went back you front and they wanted to send a maintenance person out there to fix the AC it was already after 7 p.m. Hubby insisted on another room and finally after some not nice words got it in a none pet section. New condo smelled much better so we settled in by putting our waters in the fridge, spreading out, and making a trip to walmart to buy groceries. When we returned about 2 hours later our waters were still hot. So we called the front desk they sent a guy out who informed us that the fridge needed about 24 hours to really cool down. The fridge was NOT that big! We had to put milk and stuff in the freezer and still had to throw some ruined items out the next morning. The remote in the living room DIDN"T work, electrical outlets in the bedroom DIDN"T work, the bathroom fan DIDN"T work, and there were small black ant in our shower and bathroom! The absolute worst was the PAPER THIN WALLS! I was up ALL night the first night hearing drunk loud people up and down the stairs, talking and laughing, doors slamming, the neighbors washer and dryer running. We heard WHOLE intimate conversations of our neighbors just like they were in the same room. We ended up playing the radio everynight just to try to drown out some of the ungodly noise. It didn't help much!! We were not staying the as a part of a 90 minute presention but they darn sure called and tried to get us to view their "TERRIFIC" timeshare, LOL! My hubby and I told the to shove it and that they really didn't want us in the same room with their potential timeshare owners (especially ones that were not staying there)! Good Stuff....Will say that it was centrally located to all the parks. The pool was nice, my kids enjoyed it and although we did not attend any of the daily activities, it was a great idea.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patriicat
Reviews.Content: After a 10 hour drive with an eight year old in the rain. We were told there would be a fee would would have to pay upfront. We paid to stay there and were not advised of this fee. The biggest problem I had was when we disputed the fee, we were treated SO poorly I was crying. We were unable to check in for two days because of this LIE we were told. When we finally did check in the washer and dryer were poor quality and the remote to the television was missing buttons. The floor in the bathroom had a HUGE crack in the tile. The beds are like prison bed ( prison bed was actually written on ink on one of the beds) . We were LIED to four more times by staff and management ( by the way we left four messages for him and he has not returned one). The "resort" staff are inept and some have no customer service skills. We received better customer service at the Knight's Inn ( we had to stay there for two nights until we were allowed to check in to the resort). -We were never told about any of the perks the resort has maybe because there aren't any. Save yourself the money ( in all we spent over $200 because of the resort's mix up) Go to the Regal Palm!

Reviews.Title: “this place was awesome”
Reviews.Author: leila602
Reviews.Content: i think that all these people who wrote bad reviews are pains in the butt!! this resort was clean, quiet and peaceful!! the only complain i have is that the walls were paper thin but overall it was good!! i would go back anytime but next time i would take the opportunity to take advantage of the activities they had planned!! the check in was nice and quick, the check out was the same!! they also didnt harass me about taking any tours! they pretty much let us be, which was something i wanted!! i would go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: Crestucky_Traveler
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I was extremely skeptical about this place. To my surprise, everything went smoothly from the time we showed up until we checked out. I would have to agree that the walls are thin and this could make for a rough stay if you get the wrong neighbors...true for anywhere in my opinion. As for the condo, we were happy. It had tile floors, a reasonably sized bathroom, and the pull-out sofa had a new mattress. The pool was clean and never crowded. We did spend most of our time at the parks so amenities were not a factor. If you compare this to a motel suite then I think you will be pleased. If you are expecting true resort accommodations, then you will be disappointed. If you are looking for a place that is close to the parks, clean, and friendly, I highly recommend it. Lastly, I would recommend this place to a friend, but with the information I just provided as a disclaimer.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: godzpeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August on our family vacation. I had booked a 1 bedroom with a full kitchen. We arrived in our room to discover it was a 1 bedroom with a partial kitchen. We went back to the front desk and explained the mix up. At first we were told they were booked (there were so few cars and it was almost midnight) but I didn't let up since we had brought lots of food in a cooler, much of which was to be cooked in an oven. They ended up upgrading us to a 2 bedroom in building J. This room was awesome, very clean, modern and lots of room. We spent time every day at the pool which was never crowded. They have activities each day for the kids. I loved that it was gated. The staff was very prompt with any need we had and very nice. We would go back there again for sure! We are going back to Orlando this summer to do Disney and my daughter doesn't even want to stay on Disney...she's asking to go back to Celebration World Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: dscoochie
Reviews.Content: Our room was about a 3.5 star, our friend's room was closer to a 2.5 star. The grounds are beautiful - pool is great. However, the rooms are in serious need of updating. It wasnt dirty, but not exactly spotless either. Great location, nice and close to everything. You must have a car though.

Reviews.Title: “nice location and condos”
Reviews.Author: Doglover12
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat frightened after reading some bad reviews but had already booked for two weeks; however, was pleasantly surprised. We rented the 2 bedroom executive condo and it was well set up with living area between master suite (kingsized bed, jacuzzi tub, large shower and separate water closet. Closet large but not walk in. Tile flooring in living area and bathrooms with carpet in the bedrooms. Kitchen/dining/area open and walk out screened sitting area. We had our Shitzu so the unit we stayed in was somewhat worn but quite comfortable. Our major peeve was that for the first several days there was no pool heat and hot tub was somewhat green. Also, none of the chaise chairs (if you were fortunate enough to snag one) had cushions, so with being hard plastic, they were somewhat uncomfortable. There was a convenient washroom in the pool area as well as a pop machine. The two queen sized beds in the spare room were comfortable; however, being used to a firm dense foam-type mattress, I felt every spring in the kingsized bed in the master suite. There is dial up internet available in the condos and two computers for guest use in the office/clubhouse that you can use in 30 minute increments. The dial up in the room as well as every local call costs $0.75 which is somewhat nickel/dimey to my thinking. If you enjoy condo vacationing, I would recommend this facility, inspite of the mattress. The staff especially including housekeeping the maintenance were very pleasant and helpful and we met a lot of other people, including other dog lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Jeree
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest if not the nicest Time Share properties we have been to. Unlike some of the other reviews we knew it was a timeshare and we did end up purchasing. People need to realize that the place isn't finished yet and it is still being built. As soon as you enter the gate we were amazed by the privacy and quiet. Even though we were in the bustling Disney area it was extremely private and quiet. We felt like we were out in the country somewhere. Staff was extremely friendly and we just can't say enough good about it. We have a pet and the pet buildings are awesome. Beautiful ceramic tile floors and roomy - very roomy. Bright, just wonderful. We are going back for a second stay in 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: luna99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew to Florida to meet up with my family at Celebration World Resort. My father is retired from the military so we got the resort at a great rate.. if we had paid full price I don't know that I would have given it such good reviews. The condos are spacious which is nice. We had two one bedroom condos that were connected with a common door which was nice because we could open that door and it felt like we had a huge apartment. My husband and I shared the side with the smaller bedroom, my parents and sister had the side with the huge master bedroom and giant tub. Our side was okay but the bed was small (we are used to a king sized bed) and not very comfortable. The linens in the entire place weren't very luxurious at all.. just your basic cheap sheets and comforters. I would have felt more comfortable if the sheets weren't as scratchy. All the furniture seemed a bit old and needed to be replaced but I do have to say that the condos were very clean. The kitchens were nice and big and we used the washers and dryers that were provided, that was nice. The drain in our shower was not working properly and the water would build up around your feet while you were showering. My husband went to the store and bought a bottle of drain-o to use which fixed the problem. He figured it would be quicker just to do it ourselves. On the plus side, the condos were very roomy, there were big screen tv's, they allowed dogs which is why we stayed there, and we did go swimming in the pool one afternoon which was nice. They had a volleyball net up and a beach ball floating around in the pool. The location of this "resort" is really great.. close to every disney park (which is what we were doing on our vacation, only disney) and no more than a 5-10 minute drive to where ever we were going. There are plenty of restaurants nearby but you would definitely need a car staying here.. you can't walk anywhere unless you want to get in a good work out as the main road is a good ways away. All in all, big and clean but old and worn... if this resort would only update the furniture and linens it would be 100 times better and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Organization!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeneralZ
Reviews.Content: The booking was done through www.saveonresorts.com for the nights of Dec. 24 - 26, 2008. When we arrived on the 24th, the guard at the gate wouldn't let us in because we were not on their guest list! After consulting with the front desk, we finally got in just to find that all the suites and rooms were overbooked!!!! They then sent us to another "resort" about 10-minute drive down the road to a secluded area called South Beach Resort. When we tried to check in and look at the "upgraded" two-storey townhouse condo, my wife would not even want to walk in to the property because of the terrible condition of that place: lighting was inadequate, carpets felt damp and wet, handrails were sticky, the bed (actually it was just a bare mattress) downstairs had to be flipped down from the wall and it was worn and torn out with no bed sheet on it. There were even strands of hair left on the chair. Of course, we refused to take it and had to scramble to get some kind of accommodation when most of the hotels were already fully booked on the night of the Christmas eve. Fortunately, we managed to find an overpriced room at Days Inn on the 33rd St. in Orlando that saved my family of four from having to sleep in the car that night. Now, neither Celebration World Resort nor saveonresorts.com mentioned any kind of compensation for ruining our holidays (although saveonresorts.com promised to refund my money, we had to pay much higher price to live in our least favourite hotel, Days Inn, almost right next to a large scale state or federal prison - which I found out the day we checked out of the hotel)!!!!

Reviews.Title: “:First Class: All the way!”
Reviews.Author: Magician2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Celebration's after a week of nothing but sheer relaxation and pleasure. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary there. The staff, from the parking valet, front desk manager and her staff, the bellman to the bartender and the maid service, were unbelievabled. We were made to feel at home from the moment we entered the front door. It's hard to describe the feeling as we entered the hotel. Once inside we found it difficult to leave. The piano player in the lounge area, not only played our wedding song but has us get up and dance. The entire staff was friendly, courteous , and made us feel as though we were the only guests in the hotel. It was not only us but all of the guests that were being treated this way. My wife and I have been traveling together for more then 25 years and we can honestly say that this was the first vacation where we were able to totally relax and enjoy the hotel's amenities. In the lobby there is a beautiful art gallery. Within walking distance there are shops and a variety of restaurants etc. "A plus" all the way! We highly reccommend this hotel and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: needypeople
Reviews.Content: DISCOUNT FLORIDA LODGING - Enough said. This so-called resort uses the above company to book their 'tours' of the resort. The above company promises everything under the sun: 2 more vacation packages + $150 gas card (both were rip-off gifts)! They rescinded the vacation packages and stated they didn't know anything about it. Neither did the resort. The $150 gift certificate is another promotion, buy $100 before you get $25 in gas. It has to be at ONE gas station. I am EXTREMELY upset as we bought 3 airline tickets and were given a crummy NOT 4-star resort. There was nothing resort about this place. The rooms were old and small. They had to switch our rooms as the first one was musty. Very honestly, I was in the process of considering a timeshare through RCA. NEVER AGAIN!! No more tours, no more presentations. I don't care how much they offer me. I'll pay standard rack price. BAD RESORT AND DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH FLORIDA DISCOUNT. I am alerting our local newspapers (under consumer protection) and our attorney general's office. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A "Resort"”
Reviews.Author: oldecapecod
Reviews.Content: The following is based on three "stays" at this property. The first during Hurricane Charley and the other two during two of the three subsequent hurricanes. 1. This is NOT a "resort." It is a time-share facility with no amenities. There is a pool that is sometimes cleaned and more often not. There is no restaurant - not even a snack bar. It is miles from anything that even resembles a 7-11. 2. Soundproofing is non-existent. Don't break wind or someone from a room four or five doors away will be pounding on your door complaining. 3. Many of the rooms are infested - often with fire ants. Rooms on the first level have been known to have snakes - and, yes; there are poisonous snakes throughout the property and other critters as well. 4. Housekeeping is done by an off-property crew that comes in "as needed" and rushes through the place and leaves. Anything not done might get done "next time." 5. The parking lot attendants act like FBI agents and some have been known to carry concealed firearms. This is supposedly against company policy but is overlooked. 6. The thrust of the business is to sell time-share units and they deal predominantly with hispanic prospects. "Guests" are those there for the "sales pitch" or some poor sucker who swapped a time-share for some fun in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: FunVac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Celebration World Resort in Kissimmee Florida from 8/16/2008 through 8/23/2008. Here are the pros: 1. The staff was very polite and helpful. 2. The grounds and our condo were very clean. We stayed in a Jr room which is enough room for two people and their 2 small dogs. 3. The security officer and staff made us feel safe and protected. 4. The resort is very close to all the theme parks and a variety of restaurants and shopping centers/malls. No more than 15 minutes away from Disney, Universal Studios, Seaworld, Outlet Malls, and Oldtown -which features car shows, shops and a small amusement park. 5. Very peaceful and quiet most of the time. 6. Fully equiped kitchen-dishwasher, washer/dryer, fridge, stove, convection oven/microwave, blender, toaster, coffee maker. 7. We were given a welcome basket with shampoo/conditioner, hand sanitizer, etc.....Nice welcome package. 8. Rooms are pet friendly. Not much carpet-in the bedroom only. Rest of flooring is tile. Here are the cons: 1. This resort does not have any restaurants. There are no activities on site for adults and very little for children. (This is a resort for people who do not plan to spend alot of time in their condo.) 2. The mattresses on the beds are very firm. This may be uncomfortable for some people.(Bring your airbed etc...) 3. Accomodations are not luxurous or fancy. I would rate the appearance of the rooms as what you would expect from a standard hotel. (In all fairness this may be due to the fact that the condo we stayed in was for people with pets.) 4. Clubhouse is connected to the receptionist area and needs to have more activities -maybe some exercise equipment, more table games etc..... 5. The swimming pool is small and they have one jacuzzi. Needs to be expanded. 6. Patio is very plain. Basic Plastic furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Bad beds and barking dogs”
Reviews.Author: sharonorlando
Reviews.Content: We check in on Friday, May 23, around 2:00 p.m. to notice that we didn't get the full kitchen that we had booked. Called front desk and I had to call RCI and wait for them to call the front desk. We were traveling with our dog and had to be placed in the pet friendly building. After we moved next door we could see that the full kitchen unit have a nicer kitchen, bigger living area and a nice spa type tub. After moving we just want to rest. BEWARE The pet building means Dogs. Barking dogs. I think the people next door must of used the condo for a pet kennel. Their dog braked from 9:00 p.m. till 5:00 a.m. I called the front deck every 1/2 hour to report the noise. The guy would come and we would knock on the door but NO ONE was there. There is not a manger on duty so there was nothing they could do. I was outside at 3:00a.m begging the guy that couldn't do something to PLEASE do something. Finally at 5:00 a.m. the owners came back just to walk the dog and by the time someone got to their room they had left again. And yes the dog started barking. I went to the office at 8:00 a.m . because that was the time the manger was going to be there.Well nope the manger didn't show up till 10:00 a.m. and we were moved AGAIN to a non-pet room. After no sleep and moving for the third time, we decided to go see my family and stay there for two night. We returned back to the condo on Monday and then started our vacation. Well we tried. We had a wonderful time in the pool but it is SMALL no slides nothing special. Then they have FREE pizza and BINGO. We tried to sleep there Monday night but the bed was like sleeping on bricks. I have a bad hip and I need a soft bed. I tried the pull out couch but the bar was broken in the middle. We decided Tuesday to go to Blizzard beach and the drive home. I wouldn't stay again but if I did it would be without a dog so I wouldn't risk being in the pet building and I would bring a mattress topper. Poor mangers. They didn't care about any of or problems.

Reviews.Title: “Like a cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: jj197508
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place if you spend the whole time at the parks. The resort itself was okay, the rooms were small. Not much activity throughout the small resort. You can hear toilets flushing all around you all hours from the other rooms. The bed was uncomfortable and some of the people were complaining of roaches in there rooms. We did not eat in our room so we didn't see the roaches. The wi-fi is in the lobby so if you bring a lap top you have to go to the lobby to use it. If you want housekeeping you have to pay for either standard or an upgrade otherwise you are washing your towels yourself. The swimming pool is small and the activities are not very active. If you are going to visit Disney World, the resort is fine for the price, otherwise I would not recommend this resort if you are looking to have a fun filled vacation along with Disney. It is the equivalent of staying at a cheap motel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: dsgreen5
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Disney World. We stayed in a 1 bedroom with a pull out sofa. The bathroom was quite large. The bed was surprisingly quite comfortable given that I have a bad back. There was a full kitchen with convection microwave, full size refrigerator and washer/dryer. Overall, there was everything that we needed to eat in our room. There was a screened in porch for relaxing with your morning coffee. There was internet access in the clubhouse with 2 computer. It was very easy to get on. I never had to wait. The pool was very nice. The staff was excellent. Any request we made was followed up with a call to make sure we had been taken care of.
