Customer service to the max. The location of the condo was within a few miles of Disney. A short drive to 192 to pick up I-4 which took us directly into the park. We were there and on the tram within 10-15 minutes. My only complaint would be that the carpet in the room left much to be desired. It needed to be ripped out. The room would have been better tiled.

Reviews.Title: “Grear place Close to wdw”
Reviews.Author: momto4ct
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and thought it was great. The 2bedroom unit we stayed in was very large. There was a full kitchen with dishwasher and washer, dryer. There was a large jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom and a nice screened in porch. It was very convenient to all attractions in Orlando and restuarants and stores as well. There was a nice pool and hot tub outside. The only bad thing was our room was not a non smoking room and it stunk. Our clothes stunk when we got home even though I washed them while we where there. Also they did not provided detergent for the dishwasher only liquid detergent. And who wants to wash dishes on vacation. They also did not have extra garbage bags under the sink or even inside the garbage can. They also allow pets in some untis so be sure to request non smoking and no pet rooms. They asked us if we were interested in the timeshare talk and did not push us at all when we said no thank you. A great place to stay and close to all Orlando destinations. You will need a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: katheday
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine gave me this time share unit for a week, and it was just ok. I have stayed at other time shares that blew me away and this just didn't do it. Although on the grand scheme of things a free place to stay IS better than a hotel I am paying for. That said: The unit was very small. We had a one bedroom with a very uncomfortable queen bed and my children slept on a sofa bed. There were no vases on the table, there was basically no decorative things anywhere. The room was suited for 4 but there were only three drawers in the bedroom. The bathroom was a decent size, which was nice. There was however a spot of sunshine, there is a little screened in porch. It was lovely and bug free. The pool was a little hike but worth it, heated and pretty big. The hot tub however was posessed. It made lots of creepy noises and basically shot all of it's water out of one spout. We had a great family vacation and I am writing this review so people who have stayed in time shares before will not expect the luxury they have had in the past.

Reviews.Title: “not the town of Celebration”
Reviews.Author: TravelerToo
Reviews.Content: First things first. Celebration World Resort is NOT related in any way to the town of Celebration. My fault for not checking; I thought they were. There is more difference between the two than the approximately 4 miles separating them. It is a small resort as compared to others we have stayed in around the Disney/Kissimmee area. No restaurants, no store(s), no gym and the “clubhouse” is just a reception area, with most of the building used for sales presentations. There is a trail going around a lake that is in need of much repair work. They do allow pets (small, under 30 lbs), and quite a few guests had their dogs with them and were diligent in picking up after them. The pool, while small, was clean and well maintained. Our one bedroom, one bath unit was clean, the smaller side of a 2 bedroom lockout. We declined the timeshare presentation and were not pressured after that. The partial kitchen had all the necessities, with a dishwasher and washer/ dryer. However, while the rugs looked new and clean, the bed and the couch were worn, sagging and backbreaking. Seriously, my back was aching after the first night, and continued for the week. They need new mattresses and a new couch for the living room. I would not stay here again. One positive was that I could pick up wifi from my suite, because we were fairly close to the “clubhouse”.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Resort with a nice unit--but terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: rkight57
Reviews.Content: The resort location is very nice. Very close to Disney properties, Sea World, and Downtown Disney, yet the resort itself feels very secluded. I know that everyone has different expectations when visiting time-share resorts, and I am no different. I had only one serious complaint about this resort. The unit was spacious and spotless. Everything about the unit was wonderful, except for the beds. There were three beds in this two-bedroom unit, and every one of them had incredibly uncomfortable mattresses. You could feel the springs through the padding. Furthermore, the bedding itself was the kind of cheap bedspread and blankets that you would expect at a low-rate motel. The mattress pad on our king-size bed covered only about 50% of the mattress. This really detracted from the experience for me. For some, it might not be a big deal. The grounds were also well kept, but the walking path that went around the lake needs a lot of work. There really is no place to go for a walk, except on the grounds themselves. Once again, this may or may not be an important aspect for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to say”
Reviews.Author: DeefromCleveland
Reviews.Content: We went to Spring Training in Winter Haven and traded into the resort through RCI. It was minutes away from all central Florida has to offer but quiet and secure. My only regret is that we didn't have the time to stay the full week. The staff, rooms and grouds were just fabulous. Wonderful ! Denise W. Cleveland OH

Reviews.Title: “Quiet - A great place for R & R”
Reviews.Author: iamreedeemed
Reviews.Content: I have to admitt that based on the previos ratings I was a little skeptical about this resort, but much to my surprise it exceeded ALL my expectations! It was the PERFECT resort to stay when visiting Orlando. It was settled in a quiet location away from the typical tourist traps and feel of a populated vacation area. CWR definetely made you feel lke you were at home! It was quiet and cozy and yet still so close to I192, Disney and all the attractions. Upon arrival the staff was so accomodating and friendly. They made us feel so welcomed and were genuine. Although there are timeshare tours they DO NOT hassle or pressure you at all! I am definetely returning to CWR and am considering purchasing a timeshare here in the future. They truly make travel easy and relaxing! ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: BluEyes-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Pretty resort with nice pool and lovely grounds. Very quiet for older couples with no grand children, people here on business, or pet owners. My problem with this resort is the following: Three of the four nights that I have been here, I have been disturbed after 10 PM by "engineering" AKA maintanence, claiming that I required service. I did not request service! Doesn't take the employees long to single out the single women staying here! Security here is superficial at best. The housekeeping response is very quick, the security response is ignored! A lovely resort spoiled by the intrutions that I put up with. I travel 2 weeks of every month to Fl. and have never seen worse secuirty! If you stay here...bring a body guard!

Reviews.Title: “Positive Review”
Reviews.Author: JBOFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Resort from Oct 11-14th, 2007. I have to say, I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews, but to our surprise this was a wonderful place to stay. If you are looking for a comfortable and peaceful place to stay,away from the hussel and bussel of Orlando this is the place for you. If you are into mayhem, keep looking. We checked in early and had no problem, we asked for a jacuzzi suite with a king bed....done! We were given an Executive Suite. It was on the ground floor of building K. The room had a view of the parking lot, thats not being negative,its going to happen. Since we weren't looking for a view, it worked for us. I have a feeling if we asked we would have received that also. The suite was spacious, clean and stocked with everything you could imagine.The masterbedroom had a Jacuzzi tub which was very relaxing, and a king bed. The bathroom was very large. The living area had a large screen televsion, and a full kitchen was provided, with a dining room table and couch. The lanai area was nice and always quiet. There were plenty of towels, and a stackable washer and dryer for laundry. This suite would definitely accommodate a family of four. We knew upon checking in that we would have to do a timeshare presentation. We were not called about it once we left the front lobby. We actually called to reschedule it from Friday to Saturday...done! We went to the presentation, the salesman was not pushy, he was obviously disappointed when we said no, but this is his means of living, I would be disappointed if the shoe was on the other foot, keep that in mind. Even after deciding not to buy we were graciously given our Seaworld Tickets. We live in Florida, so I would have to say compared to the other resorts out there in the same price range as Celebration, there is no competition. Just keep in mind, you need a vehicle to get around but nothing is more than twenty minutes away, there are no restaurants or stores on the property. Walmart, Publix and Walgreens are around the corner and the resort gives you directions to all. We didn't feel that these were reasons to give the resort a negative review. Retail and restaurants are not really needed, if you think about it you are coming to Orlando because your traveling, whats another five minutes to buy groceries or go out to eat. The pool was clean, we didn't swim but the kids there looked like they were enjoying themselves. On check out morning we called for a late check out at 11.....done! All in all Celebration, exceeds all others in quality, cleanliness, accommodations. customer service and affordability. Please don't be discouraged by the negative reviews. This was a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort, high quality accommodation, will stay again 11/10”
Reviews.Author: IRISHMAN999
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort with friendly helpful staff, treat staff as you expect to be treated yourself and i've never had any problems. very close to all the theme parks. This resort has only one pool at the moment but it was not very busy when we were there. it has poolside snacks like hotdogs etc., it doesn't have a restaurant nor bar on site, but it was only $12 in a cab / taxi bus taking up to 12 people to go to nearby pubs and steak houses 5mins drive etc... We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment, it had 2 kitchens, 2 living area, 2 sun rooms, 3 bathrooms, 5 tvs, jacuzzi and much more, very clean and well deorated. this resort is a silver resort but will get a gold from rci once it is completed, it was put on hold due to an increase in applications for planning due to the hurricanes. Once finished it will have another pool and amenities. RCI rate this resort a one of its highest points compare a 3br here to any other 3br in nearby resorts to see the diiference. i will be returning and possibly buying a share.10/10

Reviews.Title: “Family From Australia”
Reviews.Author: penrice
Reviews.Content: We stayed 17 days at CWR is was a highlight of our 7 week holiday.My husband ,myself and our 7 children (ages 18,16,14 13,8,6,and4) stayed in an apartment which seemed very luxurious with a huge spa /bathroom in the main bedroom.A very well appointed kitchen and washing machine/dryer,so we could be self contained. We had spent 2 weeks touring New Zealand and then a week in Hawaii. We had not had such new and spacious accommodation as CWR. We had been contacted by a promotional phone call and we booked what seemed very cheap accommodation.We had no real idea of what to expect.We hired a car as there was no public transport to the theme parks.We spent 8 days going to theme parks.2 days visiting a sister who had gone to Florida that week to live,and a number of days just relaxing at CWR.It was a fantastic place for the children.It was quiet,we often had the beautiful pool to ourselves during the day. Our teenagers stayed in the spa every night until the security guy came to lock the gates. There was a huge screen T.V. in the main living area and large t.v's in every room with cable t.v. (lots of channels). Two young girls provided activities in the day for us and any other children . Our girls had their hair beaded,we had a movie night and pizza.pool volleyball and basketball game for our family. We were given a sheet with the entertainment and activities that would be provided. There was a pool party with music, games and prizes.It was not very busy and some of the activities only had our yougest children in them, but they still ran them and were very friendly. We went on to stay in Switzerland and Singapore, none of the accommadation was as smart as CWR it was a highlight for our children on the holiday and we are thinking of visiting you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't buy at Celebration”
Reviews.Author: vacationtraveler527
Reviews.Content: Celebration Management is unpleasant and the resort does not have much to offer. No restaurants and one pool. When I became an owner 7 years ago, they promised a lot more. Not much have been done since then. Very disappointed! I wouldn't suggest anyone buy a timeshare from Celebration World Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home !!!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Crew_Houston
Reviews.Content: I've been an owner at CWR since its conception. I periodicly read guest review to see what other's opinions are. It seems that alot of the negative reviews written are by guest that arrived at the resort already in a sore mood prior to arriving.My family and I have stayed at the resort once every year during March, Summer, and the last visit was in October 2006. We will happily be returning to the resort in late May. We have always been treated very respectful by the staff. Check in is quick and easy and we were given an available room prior to the posted check in time. The Jr-1 bedroom suite is roomy enough for a family of four. It is clean and stocked with enough dishes for four people (buy plastic plates). The kitchen is fully stocked with most of the essential cooking utensils needed on a daily basis (office gives a list or maybe willing to review it with you). A junior size, stacked washer and dryer is located in the kitchen. I would advise guest to buy more laundry detergent, bcuz most families will need more than is provided. The living room TV is surprisingly large and has a DVD player. The game station was very easy for us to set up. In October the pool was heated and clean towel are always provided by the poolside. It also has walk-in beach access (pool), great for the children and a water mushroom (see our photos). A fenced playground is located next to the pool. The resort grounds, as well as the pool, are well maintained and kept groomed and up to date. Beautiful Palms surrounds the pool as well as the rest of the resort. The courtyards in each buildings are perfect for pictures. The resort offers family activities during the evenings, such as Pizza and a Movie night or Pizza and Bingo with fun prizes. During the summer months daytime activities and pool games were offered to the children. We have no complaints about the resort. We've always been happy and look foward to returning each year ! (See our photos)

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Melanieann
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about the reviews left for this resort. My husband and 2 teenage boys and myself just spend a wonderful week there. I really would be hard pressed to find anything to complain about. Our 2 bedrooms condo was clean, and fully equiped with new appliances. The boys bedroom had 2 double bed and TV. They loved it. Nice big hall bath. The master br had huge jacuzzi tub and big shower. Nice king bed and TV. Pool area clean, no problem. I saw activites for kids, but we didn't participate in any. This resort is not in city of Celebration. Nor is on the main drag..that was its beauty to me. Very quiet and peaceful. You must have a car to stay here. It is not walking distance to anything. It is less than 7 mins. to turn off for Disney. Also their directions to turn off at 64B are a bit confusing, since there is no 64B..only 64 which is what you want. Lots of construction and 64B is gone for a while I guess. We had a nice meal at California Grill in Disney. Very busy, but enjoyed fireworks. We found out later that you could go outside to watch..but no one told us. All in all great time and happy with our RCI trade.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for meetings”
Reviews.Author: Kentuckyplanner
Reviews.Content: Meeting planners will want to know that this is an excellent place to hold meetings. The conference center is separate from the hotel. The conference rooms are refurbished and nicely remodeled with a fresh, new, modern look and feel. The food was very good, nicely presented, and relatively-reasonably priced. The staff was very attentive. The hotel rooms are nicely remodeled with a mini-fridge in each room, and the most comfortable beds imaginable. The grounds were lovely. This hotel beats a larger, stuffier, older hotel any time. You can walk to Charley’s Steak House and Kobe’s Japanese or drive a short distance to Celebration for many more dining options. I highly recommend this hotel. Overall – great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Essex_girl-7
Reviews.Content: I was worried after having seen conflicting reviews of this property as to what it would be like. We arrived late at night and were checked in efficiently. The apartment was above average in size with good sized rooms and all the fittings you would expect. This was a 2 bedroom apartment with the main bedroom having a jacuzzi bath - but be warned! If you are a little shy you won't like the fact that the toilet doesn't have a door! The welcome pack is very poor - only coffee, whitener, washing up liquid, 4 toilet rolls and 1 roll of kitchen paper. You need a car to get anywhere so make sure you buy the essentials on your way from the airport as there is no shop in the complex. The downside is that the apartment is not cleaned - if you wish to have the linen and towels changed or the apartment cleaned you need to pay extra. The pool area is great - pool towels are provided. Location is great for the Disney Parks - only 10 mins away and very easy roads to get there. It's a bit further for Universal or SeaWorld but with no traffic it's still less than 30 mins. Overall I was pleasantly surprised and did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: purple418
Reviews.Content: Please don't get suckered into this resort like we did. The management is awful, they don't care about the owners who invested their money into the resort. They say instead of using your RCI points to stay there that you can just pay owner VIP rates, which at first glance seem very inexpensive, but not after they double them every year. Every single thing they tell you during their sales pitch is a lie. The manager called security on me because I wanted them to hold our luggage so we could go to get something to eat while our room (which they said would be ready in 10 minutes) was being cleaned. I have 2 small children who wanted to eat a get changed out of their heavy clothes, the least they could do was hold a couple of bags for us so that we could go do that. They only decent person there, a security guard, came and offered to lock our luggage in his office so we had room for everyone to sit in the car. The manager only called security because she was afraid the people that they were trying to get to buy there would hear they way you get treated when you are an owner. After coming back 2 hours later - you guessed it - the room was still not ready. After argueing for another half hour - I decided to call RCI, they ended up placing us at another resort, the one we should have invested our money in. I made sure to advise everyone I saw there that day not to waste their money to buy there, because they will be sorry like I am. No wonder RCI downgraded them from their gold crown status.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, don't choose this one.”
Reviews.Author: Anned22
Reviews.Content: Bathrooms were clean, carpet was dirty, there were no comforters or duvets, there were extra sheets that we used (had to use 2 full sized ones on a queen sized bed) The couch was by far the most uncomfortable couch I've ever sat on. It was low to the ground, dirty, and very uncomfortable. I retired every night to the bedroom to watch TV because I couldn't sit on it. The location was also very confusing to get to the parks. Back roads, etc. Would NOT reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: aydenrocks
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, kitchen and bath (2) nice, carpets and sheets could be changed (stains). Staff was friendly. Excellent pool for kids. Location is ok, a little out of the way, but not to far.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better resort”
Reviews.Author: brymil
Reviews.Content: I am not a timeshare owner but booked this resort as a guest of a friend. The resort is nice and the staff was friendly and responsive. However, we had several issues during our stay. The first night we noticed the patio door lock was broken. Within minutes a maintenance person was there and fixed it (at 10PM!). However, the second involved bugs. We had many very tiny crawling insects throughout the unit. According to the management, they enter through the door. They sprayed the entry-way but it did not do much good. The second bug issue was a type of cockroach that is common in Florida. We had two cases with the roaches in the kitchen. Although I did confirm (through a bug expert at Animal Kingdom) that the roaches are not your normal cockroach associated with uncleanliness, nonetheless, it was disturbing. According to the management, bugs are less of a problem on 2nd and 3rd floors. The third issue was the overall cleanliness of the unit. The carpets were filthy. The bottoms of our feet were black from walking on them. Little cleaning attention is given to areas around the toilet, tubs, and sinks. The king mattress was also so worn on one side that you could not lay anywhere near the edge without falling off. And, as mentioned in other reviews, if you stay on a bottom floor you will hear toilets flushing above and chairs being moved. My total cost for the entire week amounted to less than $300 so I still felt I got a good deal. However, if I had paid out thousands to be a timeshare owner and ended up at Celebration World, I would have been sorely disappointed. My advice, find a better resort!

Reviews.Title: “What a find !!”
Reviews.Author: jersey1010
Reviews.Content: Not many timeshares allow pets... this was a true find. The resort is clean, well staffed by friendly and helpful workers. The two buildings that allow small pets are well kept and nicely furnished. NO pet odors at all. The master bed room was large with sliding doors out on to a screened lanai, whirlpool tub, large shower stall and a privacy toilet. Large screen tv in livingroom ( smaller tvs in each bedroom ) and well equipped kitchen. The pool area was clean with plenty of chairs and towels. Overall this was a great find in the Orlando area. Disney ten minutes away, plenty of area resturants and shops. On check in they provided a booklet telling how to get to the main attractions and the outlet malls... Two thumbs up to this lovely resort.... quiet, clean, friendly and close to all Orlando attractions !!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family recently stay at the Celebration World Resorts and found it to be a very nice surprise. Our check-in went well with no surprises or snafus to start our vacation. We had the larger of the one bedroom units and found it to be very spacious. Bedroom: King sized bed and a small tv (no VCR or DVD player) and a large jacuzzi tub in the room. Bathroom: There is a very large closet with plenty of hangers, a large stand up shower, hair dryer, and private toilet. Bring extra toilet paper. Living room: a large screen television with VCR, a pull out bed in the couch, coffee table and chair, and a round dining room table with 6 chairs. Kitchen: full-sized with a large refrigerator, dishwasher, stacked clothes washer and dryer, full stove and oven, toaster, microwave, and clothes iron and ironing board. There were a few pots and pans and enough silverware for 6 people. There is a nice screen enclosed balcony with a lounge chair and 2 sitting chairs with entry from the bedroom or living room. The staff was very friendly and the grounds are very nicely kept. There are grills peppered throughout the grounds and a mulch jogging track with exercise stations and a basketball court. The pool area was larger than an average motel pool and is perfect for small children (clean towels are provided). It has a small hot tub for no more than 5 adults but there are plenty of lounge chairs. The are a few negative comments that come to mind. The king bed was a typical motel bed and very firm. The walls are relatively thin and you can hear the neighbor's toilet flush while laying in bed. Fortunately not loud enough to wake you up. Since we stayed on the top floor I can't comment on the noise level from the upper room. Except for the pool there aren't alot of activities for kids. If you don't want to wash dishes every night I recommend you bring paper plates and plasticware. There is a grocery store about a half mile from the resort and several restaurants close by. The theme parks are a 10 minute drive from the resort if you leave early. If you leave after 8:30 am then expect a 15 to 20 minute drive. Everything considered we would definitely stay here again. It was a nice stay and surprisingly nobody called our room the entire week for the "tour and salespitch".

Reviews.Title: “Good location but just a sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was clean and well equipped, but it is obviously geared up just to sell their other 'holidaypoints' programme. There was no supermarket or even small shop The reception didn't even have an adapter plug we could borrow We were shipped out on our first night to alternative accommodation - which we really didn't need after a very long journey with children Our timing for the mandatary presentation was messed up so we nearly lost 2 days of our weeks holiday instead of just one. The staff were friendly and helpful and the 'help desk' people were great (even though we only found out who they were by mistake) We didn't feel welcomed or looked after as guests at the resort but more that we were being 'put up' in order for them to sell us their product. But, the Disney theme parks were only 10 minutes away (if you managed to find the right route) YOU DO NEED YOUR OWN TRANSPORT

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week at this resort and found it to be clean, friendly staff, nice pool area and very convenient to all the attractions you go to Orlando to visit. As the rooms had a nice kitchenette area it also made it cost effective for a group of four people. Only time we asked the front desk for something it was delivered to the door in under 15 minutes. Overall a solid, safe place to stay(24 hour security on the front gate).

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really can not wait to go back. I have stayed in many hotels and accommodations around the world, and this by far was one of the best. There was everything that one would need to make their time as comfortable as possible with so much more. The accommodation was clean and fresh, well maintained and of a very good standard. With 2 huge televisions, a video player, washing machine and dryer, huge microwave, cooker and fridge, there was nothing else that we required. On arrival, we had water, washing powder and a few other essentials to get us started which was nice. We even had a jacuzzi in the master bedroom which was relaxing after a day at the park!! I expected it to be nice, but I did not expect it to be so nice and I was plesently surprised at how nice it really was. I am however slightly confused about some of the other reviews that have complianed about the resort and actually decided to stop reading the reviews before I went away as I was starting to feel rather nervous. Need not worry. The resort was peaceful and being a teacher I went during my half term, so I expected to see and hear children. NEVER once did I hear anything, not even from the people next door and yes there were people staying next door to us. There are a few Bar B Ques around by the pond that you are free to use and generally, there was a great atmosphere there day in day out, The reception was nice and had a friendly feel to it. All staff that I encountered during my stay we kind and helpful. There was free internet service, videos to rent for the player in the room, and a few sporting activities. A car is a must and I suggest you get one of these to get you around the place even though the resprt is fairly central, especially for all the shopping that we done. I really can not wait to go back. Infact, I am currently awaiting confirmation for another booking for next summer. Had a great time and I recommend it to anyone thinking of going Have fun!!! ANy questions email me. More than happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Me and Spicey really loved it here”
Reviews.Author: spiceycat
Reviews.Content: We dearly love it at CWR. They have 1, 2 or 3 bedroom villa. the 2 bedroom and up have a full kitchen. Some of the kitchens in a 1-bedroom only have a microwave and cook top - not a stove. they all have dishwashers plus a washer and dryer for your cloths. a big TV in the livingroom with a VCR, a smaller TV in the bedrooms. the people here are make what this resort excellent. they really care and try their best to help you. some of the staff comes from Mexico, Puerto Rico and some places in Central American. but despite a language barrier they definitely try their best to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can not wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jcboor
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. We had planned on one day to go the Walt Disney World but instead we stayed back at the heated pool with the music and enjoyed the beautiful Orlando weather. The pool was heated and the water temperature was just like bath water. We could not believe all the activities that this resort had to offer. We had no children with us but this is where we would want to bring them. We have stayed at Westgate, Vacation Village and the Celebration World is the best. We had no problem with check-in it only took 2 minutes. The only thing that we can say bad about this resort is our vacation had to end. We are already planning another trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: MemphisMomof2
Reviews.Content: This resort is very close to Disney. It took us less than 10 minutes every morning to arrive at the parks. The resort is quiet and provided the nice respite we needed after a day at the parks. Staff was helpful, unit was clean and spacious. Will definitely stay here again,

HotelInfo.Name: Celebration World Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 7503 Atlantis Way, Kissimmee, FL 34747
